name: HD 4203
scenarioDescription:
The HD 4203 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 4203 is a star with 1.25 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.42 times its radius. It is located 266.05 light years away from the solar system.

HD 4203 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 4203 system


HD 4203 b

HD 4203 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.17 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 4203 b is 709.14 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 4203 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 4203 c

HD 4203 c was discovered by the Gemini Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 6.95 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 4203 c is 690.06 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 4203 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 4203, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by W. M. Keck Observatory.
